history.content:
Hello all!!

We, on behalf of California Actuarial League, will be facilitating the following three DeCals! The courses are designed to jumpstart your actuarial career. If you are not interested in an actuarial career, these courses will also help you enhance your skills that can potentially be helpful in your early careers as well!

  1. Actuarial Exam 1/Probability Preparatory (STAT 198):

This course is intended for students exploring the actuarial career and is designed to prepare students for the Actuarial Exam 1/P, administered by the SOA (Society of Actuaries) and CAS (Casualty Actuarial Society). We will cover the topics listed in the exam syllabus provided by the SOA, including general probability, univariate and multivariate probability distributions, moment generating functions, and more. People with basic probability background is recommended but not required. Please fill in the form for enrollment if you interested: https://forms.gle/SapjGQ4ymckwFdyV9. If you have any questions about the course or enrollment, please contact Zehao: zehao_zhao@berkeley.edu The link to the decal is: https://decal.berkeley.edu/courses/6132.

  1. Actuarial Exam 2/Financial Math Preparatory (FM) (MATH 198):

FM is the second actuarial exam that you will need to take if you are pursuing a career in the actuarial industry. The course is designed to help you pass the FM exam. If you are not taking the exam, this course could also be for you if you are interested in finance! Please send an email to gvalent2@berkeley.edu if you are interested in the course and want to enroll!

  1. Actuarial Data Analytics (ADA) (STAT 198):

Interested in actuarial science but don’t know where to start? Actuarial Data Analytics is a course designed to introduce you to the field of actuarial science through various data analysis and statistical techniques, which you may have already learned in class before! This course will adapt these concepts to actuarial science and give an overview of the various problems actuaries face on a day-to-day basis. Prerequisites are just some coding background and basic probability knowledge. If you have any questions, please email

aryanc@berkeley.edu! The link to the decal is https://decal.berkeley.edu/courses/6151

If you are interested, please reach out to the following contact or fill out some enrollment form (depending on the course). Thank you!
history.subject: Actuarial DeCals
